alert.note: Alert for Gogebic (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 13 at 6:40AM EDT until April 16 at 11:00AM EDT by NWS Marquette
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Michigan... East Branch Escanaba River at Gwinn affecting Marquette County. Chocolay River near Harvey affecting Marquette County. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Michigan... Middle Branch Escanaba River at Humboldt affecting Marquette County. Black River near Bessemer affecting Gogebic County. .Snowmelt will lead to high river levels. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE SUNDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Black River near Bessemer. * WHEN...Until late Sunday morning. * IMPACTS...At 12.0 feet, Water reaches the bottom of Hedberg Road Bridge * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 5:00 AM CDT Thursday the stage was 11.2 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 5:00 AM CDT Thursday was 11.4 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 11.7 feet this morning. It will then fall below flood stage late Saturday morning. - Flood stage is 10.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 11.7 feet on 08/16/1972. - www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/marquette. The next statement will be issued by this afternoon at 400 PM EDT /300 PM CDT/.
